es_translation: I put on a good face when I turned around. —Thank you, thank you, thank you! —I told them, although I was sure I didn't seem as effusive now that I was pretending.

en: I hadn’t showered or dressed or anything. Well, not that I would technically be dressing, but still. “I don’t have to be there until twelve-thirty,” I said. “I need to, like, get ready.”
vi: Tôi chưa tắm rửa thay quần áo, chưa bất cứ gì cả. Ờ, như vậy không có nghĩa là tôi sẽ thực sự mặc đồ, nhưng vẫn cần thời gian chứ. “Mười hai rưỡi con mới phải có mặt,” tôi nói. “Con cần chuẩn bị nữa ạ.”
tr: Ne duş almıştım ne de giyinmiştim. Şey, teknik olarak giyinik olacağımdan değil ama yine de... “Saat yanma kadar orada olmak zorunda değilim,” dedim. “Hazırlanmam falan gerekiyor.
es: No me había duchado, ni vestido, ni nada. Bueno, para ser exacto, tampoco tenía que vestirme, pero en fin. —No tengo que estar allí hasta las doce y media —les dije—. Tengo que arreglarme.
vi_translation: I haven't showered or changed clothes, haven't done anything at all. Well, that doesn't mean I'll actually get dressed, but it still takes time. "You don't have to be there until twelve-thirty," I said. "I still need to get ready."
tr_translation: I had neither taken a shower nor gotten dressed. Well, technically I wouldn't be dressed anyway, but still... “I don't have to be there until about the time of the fire,” I said. “I need to get ready and all.”
es_translation: I hadn't showered, nor dressed, nor anything. Well, to be exact, I didn't have to dress either, but anyway. —I don't have to be there until twelve-thirty —I told them—. I have to get ready.

en: For the first time in weeks, she seemed completely and undeniably alive to me. She was alive. For one more day at least, she was alive. I had focused on her whereabouts for so long in an attempt to keep me from obsessively wondering whether she was alive that I had no idea how terrified I’d been until now, but oh, my God. She was alive.
vi: Lần đầu tiên từ mấy tuần nay, Margo trở nên hoàn toàn, không thể phủ nhận được, sống động đối với tôi. Cô ấy còn sống. Ít nhất thêm một ngày nữa, cô ấy vẫn còn sống. Tôi đã chú tâm quá lâu đến những lang bạt của Margo, để không bị ám ảnh trong mớ bòng bong băn khoăn không biết cô ấy còn sống hay không, lâu đến mức tôi không nhận ra rằng mình đã cảm thấy sợ hãi chừng nào, cho đến lúc này. Ôi, ơn Chúa. Cô ấy còn sống.
tr: Haftalardır ilk defa, Margo bana tamamen ve reddedilemez bir biçimde hayatta görünüyordu. Hayattaydı. En azından bir gün daha hayattaydı. Onun hayatta olup olmadığını merak etmekten kendimi alıkoymak amacıyla o kadar uzun zamandır bulunduğu yere odaklanmıştım ki, şimdiye kadar ne kadar korktuğum hakkında hiçbir fikrim yoktu ama ah, Tannm... Hayattaydı.
es: Por primera vez en semanas no tuve la menor duda de que estaba viva. Estaba viva. Y estaría viva al menos un día más. Me había centrado tanto tiempo en localizarla, sobre todo para evitar preguntarme obsesivamente si estaba viva, que no me había dado cuenta de lo aterrorizado que había estado hasta entonces, pero, oh, Dios mío. Estaba viva.
vi_translation: For the first time in weeks, Margo became completely, undeniably, alive to me. She was still alive. At least for one more day, she was still alive. I had focused for so long on Margo's wanderings, being obsessed with the tangled mess of wondering whether she was alive or not, for so long that I didn't realize how scared I had been until now. Oh, thank God. She was still alive.
tr_translation: For the first time in weeks, Margo looked completely and undeniably alive to me. She was alive. At least for one more day, she was alive. To stop myself from wondering whether she was alive or not, for so long she had been I was so focused on the place that I had no idea how scared I had been until now, but oh, my God... He was alive.
es_translation: For the first time in weeks, I had no doubt that she was alive. She was alive. And she would be alive for at least one more day. I had focused so much time on locating her, mainly to avoid obsessively asking myself if she was alive, that I hadn't realized how terrified I had been until then, but, oh, my God. She was alive.

en: Radar is the last to get off the phone, and when he finally does, he says, “I’d like to make an announcement. My parents are very annoyed that I’m missing graduation. My girlfriend is also annoyed, because we were scheduled to do something very special in about eight hours. I don’t want to get into details about it, but this had better be one fun road trip.”
vi: Radar là đứa cuối cùng đặt điện thoại xuống, rút cục nó thông báo, “Tôi xin tuyên bố đây. Bố mẹ tôi rất cáu vì tôi không dự lễ tốt nghiệp. Bạn gái tôi cũng cáu, vì hai đứa đã lên kế hoạch làm một việc đặc biệt trong vòng tám tiếng nữa. Tôi không muốn đi vào tiểu tiết, nhưng tốt hơn hết đây nên là một chuyến bám đường hoành tráng.
tr: Radar telefondan kurtulan son kişi ve nihayet kurtulduğunda şöyle diyor: “Bir duyuru yapmak istiyorum. Ebeveynlerim mezuniyeti kaçırmama sinirlendiler. Kız arkadaşım da sinirlendi çünkü yaklaşık sekiz saat içinde çok özel bir şey yapmayı planlıyorduk. Ayrıntıya girmek istemiyorum ama gerçekten eğlenceli bir yolculuk olsa iyi olur.
es: Radar es el último en colgar el teléfono, y cuando por fin lo hace, dice: —Me gustaría comunicaros algo: mis padres están muy enfadados porque no esté en la graduación. Mi novia también está muy enfadada, porque habíamos organizado algo muy especial dentro de ocho horas. No quiero entrar en detalles, pero más vale que el viaje sea divertido.
vi_translation: Radar was the last one to put down the phone, finally announcing, "I declare this. My parents are very angry because I'm not attending the graduation ceremony. My girlfriend is also angry because we had planned to do something special in the next eight hours. I don't want to go into details, but this better be an epic road trip."
tr_translation: The last person to escape from the radar phone, and when he finally escaped, he said: "I want to make an announcement. My parents were angry that I missed the graduation. My girlfriend was also angry because we were planning to do something very special in about eight hours. I don't want to go into details, but it better be a really fun trip."
es_translation: Radar is the last one to hang up the phone, and when he finally does, he says: —I would like to tell you something: my parents are very angry because I am not at the graduation. My girlfriend is also very angry, because we had organized something very special in eight hours. I don't want to go into details, but the trip better be fun.

en: By now we are on I-4, and traffic is fairly light, which in and of itself is borderline miraculous. I’m in the far left lane driving eight miles an hour over the fifty-five-miles-per-hour speed limit, because I heard once that you don’t get pulled over until you’re going nine miles an hour over the speed limit.
vi: Chúng tôi đang đi trên cao tốc liên bang I-4, giao thông tương đối thưa, chính thế càng thêm phần may mắn không ngờ. Tôi đang chạy xe ở làn ngoài cùng bên trái, vượt tám dặm một giờ so với tốc độ cho phép năm mươi lăm dặm một giờ, vì có lần tôi từng nghe nói rằng phải vượt đến chín dặm một giờ mới bị cảnh sát bắt dừng lại.
tr: Artık I4’teyiz ve trafik oldukça az ki bu gerçekten bir mucize. Saatte doksan kilometrelik hız sınırından on dört kilometre fazla hızla, en sol şeritte gidiyorum çünkü bir keresinde hız sınırından on beş kilometre hızh sürünce arabanın polis tarafından kenara çekilmediğini duydum.
es: Estamos en la I-4, y el tráfico es fluido, lo que en sí mismo roza lo milagroso. Vamos por el carril de la izquierda a diez kilómetros por hora por encima del límite de velocidad, que es de noventa, porque una vez me dijeron que solo te pillan si te pasas más de quince kilómetros.
vi_translation: We are driving on the I-4 interstate, the traffic is relatively sparse, which makes it even more unexpectedly fortunate. I am driving in the far left lane, exceeding the speed limit of fifty-five miles per hour by eight miles per hour, because I once heard that you have to exceed by nine miles per hour to be stopped by the police.
tr_translation: We are now on I4 and the traffic is quite light, which is truly a miracle. I am driving in the far left lane at fourteen kilometers per hour over the ninety kilometers per hour speed limit because I once heard that the police don't pull over cars that are only fifteen kilometers per hour over the speed limit.
es_translation: We are on the I-4, and the traffic is smooth, which in itself borders on the miraculous. We are in the left lane going ten kilometers per hour above the speed limit, which is ninety, because once I was told that they only catch you if you exceed by more than fifteen kilometers.

en: “Oh, I know!” I say from the front. “You spy a twenty-four-hour road trip in a minivan. Hip because road trips always are; tragic because the gas we’re guzzling will destroy the planet.”
vi: “Ồ, tôi biết!” tôi nói vọng xuống. “Ông phát hiện ra hành trình bám đường dài hai mươi tư tiếng trong một chiếc minivan. Sành điệu vì những chuyến bám đường luôn như vậy; khủng khiếp vì lượng xăng bọn mình ngốn sẽ phá hủy hành tinh này.”
tr: “Ah, biliyorum!” diyorum ön taraftan. “Minivanda yirmi dört saatlik bir yolculuk görüyorsun. Moda, çünkü yolculuklar her zaman öyledir; trajik çünkü lıkır lıkır içtiğimiz benzin gezegeni yok edecek.”
es: —¡Ya sé! —digo yo—. Ves un viaje por carretera de veinticuatro horas en un monovolumen. Está a la última porque los viajes por carretera siempre están a la última, y es trágico porque la gasolina que chupa este coche destruirá el planeta.
vi_translation: “Oh, I know!” I shouted down. “You discovered the twenty-four-hour road trip in a minivan. Stylish because road trips are always like that; terrible because the amount of gas we consume will destroy the planet.”
tr_translation: “Ah, I know!” I say from the front. “You see a twenty-four-hour journey in a minivan. Fashionable, because journeys are always like that; tragic because the gasoline we guzzle will destroy the planet.”
es_translation: —I know! —I say—. You see a twenty-four-hour road trip in a minivan. It's trendy because road trips are always trendy, and it's tragic because the gas this car guzzles will destroy the planet.

en: Radar says no, and they keep guessing. I am driving and going seventy-two and praying not to get a ticket and playing Metaphysical I Spy. The tragically hip thing turns out to be failing to turn in your rented graduation robes on time. I blow past a cop parked on the grass median. I grip the steering wheel hard with both hands, feeling sure he’ll race up to pull us over. But he doesn’t. Maybe he knows I’m only speeding because I have to.
vi: Radar vẫn bảo không phải, và chúng tôi lại đoán tiếp. Tôi đang lái xe, giữ tốc độ bảy mươi hai dặm một giờ, cầu mong không bị phạt vi phạm giao thông và đang chơi Tôi Phát Hiện phiên bản siêu hình. Điều sành điệu khủng khiếp hóa ra là việc mớ áo chùng đi thuê này sẽ không được đem trả đúng hẹn. Tôi nhấn ga chạy nhanh qua một cảnh sát đang dừng trên dải cỏ phân cách. Tôi nắm chặt vô-lăng bằng cả hai tay, cảm tưởng chắc như ăn bắp là chú cảnh sát sẽ đuổi theo và tấp tôi vào lề đường. Nhưng chú ấy không đuổi theo, chắc biết rằng tôi chỉ phóng nhanh vì tôi buộc phải như vậy.
tr: Radar hayır diyor ve tahmin yürütmeye devam ediyorlar. Arabayı sürüyorum, yüz on beşle gidiyorum ve trafik cezası almamak için dua ederken Fizikötesi Görüyorum oynuyorum. Trajik bir şekilde moda olan şeyin, kiralık mezuniyet cübbesini zamanında iade etmemek olduğu ortaya çıkıyor. Refüjde park etmiş bir polis arabasının yamndan rüzgâr gibi geçiyorum. Bizi kenara çekmek için hızla geleceğinden emin bir şekilde iki elimle direksiyona sıkıca yapışıyorum. Ama öyle yapmıyor. Belki de yalnızca mecbur olduğum için hız yaptığımı biliyor.
es: Radar dice que no y siguen intentando adivinarlo. Me mantengo en ciento quince kilómetros por hora, rezo para que no me pongan una multa y juego al veo veo metafísico. Lo trágicamente a la última resulta ser no conseguir devolver las togas alquiladas a tiempo. Dejo atrás a toda velocidad un coche de policía parado en la mediana de hierba. Sujeto el volante con fuerza, con las dos manos, convencido de que va a perseguirnos y a hacernos parar. Pero no. Quizá el poli sabe que voy a esa velocidad porque no me queda más remedio.
vi_translation: Radar still insisted it wasn't, and we continued guessing. I was driving, maintaining a speed of seventy-two miles per hour, hoping not to get a traffic ticket, and playing a metaphysical version of I Spy. The terribly stylish thing turned out to be that this rented robe wouldn't be returned on time. I pressed the gas pedal to speed past a police officer who was stopped on the median strip. I gripped the steering wheel with both hands, feeling certain that the officer would chase after me and pull me over. But he didn't chase after me, probably knowing that I was speeding because I had to.
tr_translation: Radar says no and they continue to guess. I'm driving the car, going at one hundred fifteen, and playing Metaphysical I Spy while praying not to get a speeding ticket. It turns out that the tragically fashionable thing is not returning the rented graduation gown on time. I speed past a police car parked on the median like the wind. Gripping the steering wheel tightly with both hands, I'm certain it will quickly come to pull us over. But it doesn't. Maybe it knows that I'm speeding only because I have to.
es_translation: Radar says no and they keep trying to guess it. I maintain a speed of one hundred and fifteen kilometers per hour, pray that I don't get a ticket, and play metaphysical I spy. The tragically up-to-date thing turns out to be not being able to return the rented robes on time. I speed past a police car stopped in the grassy median. I grip the steering wheel tightly with both hands, convinced that it will chase us and make us stop. But no. Maybe the cop knows that I'm going at this speed because I have no other choice.

en: “Q. Sweetie. You’re a boy. You don’t know how to do these things. The NoDoz is with the chocolate and the Mountain Dew, because those things all contain caffeine and help you stay up. The NyQuil is with the beef jerky because eating meat makes you feel tired.”
vi: “Q thân mến, chàng trai ngây thơ quá, làm sao hiểu được phạm trù này. NoDoz đi với sô-cô-la và Mountain Dew, vì những thứ đó đều có ca-phê-in và làm cậu tỉnh. NyQuil ở cùng thịt bò khô vì ăn thịt sẽ làm cậu mệt.”
tr: “Q. Tatlım. Sen bir erkeksin. Böyle şeylerin nasıl yapılacağını bilmezsin. NoDoz, çikolata ve Mountain Dew’la birlikte çünkü bunların hepsi kafein içeriyor ve uyanık kalmana yardımcı oluyorlar. NyQuil kurutulmuş etle birlikte çünkü et yemek yorgun hissetmene neden olur.
es: —Q, cariño, eres un crío. No sabes cómo van estas cosas. La cafeína va con el chocolate y el Mountain Dew, que también tienen cafeína, que sirve para mantenerte despierto. El antihistamínico, que da sueño, va con la cecina porque comer carne hace que te canses.
vi_translation: “Dear Q, you are too naive to understand this category. NoDoz goes with chocolate and Mountain Dew because they all contain caffeine and keep you awake. NyQuil goes with beef jerky because eating meat will make you tired.”
tr_translation: “Q. Sweetheart. You are a man. You don't know how to do these things. NoDoz, chocolate, and Mountain Dew together because they all contain caffeine and help you stay awake. NyQuil with jerky because eating meat makes you feel tired.”
es_translation: —Q, darling, you are a kid. You don't know how these things work. Caffeine goes with chocolate and Mountain Dew, which also have caffeine, which helps to keep you awake. The antihistamine, which makes you sleepy, goes with jerky because eating meat makes you tired.

en: We’re driving alongside a Hispanic woman in a beat-up old Toyota Corolla. I watch her through the early darkness. “Left her family to move here,” I say. “Illegal. Sends money back home on the third Tuesday of every month. She’s got two little kids—her husband is a migrant. He’s in Ohio right now—he only spends three or four months a year at home, but they still get along really well.”
vi: Chúng tôi lái song song một cô người Hispanic[9] đi chiếc Toyota Corolla đã cũ. Tôi quan sát cô ấy khi trời bắt đầu nhập nhoạng. “Bỏ gia đình để đến đây,” tôi nói. “Cư trú bất hợp pháp. Gửi tiền về nhà vào thứ Ba của tuần thứ ba hàng tháng. Cô ấy có hai con nhỏ–chồng là dân di cư. Hiện giờ chú chồng đang ở Ohio–một năm chỉ ở nhà khoảng ba, bốn tháng, nhưng hai vợ chồng vẫn rất ổn.
tr: Oldukça eski bir Toyota Corolla’daki Hispanik bir kadınla yan yana gidiyoruz. Erken çöken karanlığın içinden kadım izliyorum. “Buraya taşınmak için ailesini terk etmiş,” diyorum. “Yasadışı. Her ayın üçüncü sah gününde eve para gönderiyor. İki küçük çocuğu var, kocası göçmen. Şu anda Ohio’da, yılda sadece üç dört ayı evde geçiriyor ama yine de gerçekten iyi geçiniyorlar.
es: Vamos al lado de una mujer hispana que conduce un viejo y destartalado Toyota Corolla. La observo en la temprana oscuridad. —Dejó a su familia para venirse aquí —digo—. Sin papeles. Manda dinero a su casa el tercer martes de cada mes. Tiene dos hijos pequeños. Su marido es inmigrante. En estos momentos vive en Ohio. Solo pasa tres o cuatro meses al año en su casa, pero su familia se las arregla bastante bien.
vi_translation: We drove alongside a Hispanic woman[9] in an old Toyota Corolla. I watched her as the sky began to darken. “Left her family to come here,” I said. “Living here illegally. Sends money home on the third Tuesday of every month. She has two small children–her husband is a migrant worker. Right now, her husband is in Ohio–he's only home about three or four months a year, but the couple is doing just fine.”
tr_translation: We are driving side by side with a Hispanic woman in a rather old Toyota Corolla. I am watching the woman through the early falling darkness. "She left her family to move here," I say. "Illegal. She sends money home on the third day of every month. Two small children Her husband is an immigrant. Currently, he is in Ohio, spending only three or four months a year at home, but they still get along really well.”
es_translation: We go next to a Hispanic woman driving an old and dilapidated Toyota Corolla. I observe her in the early darkness. —She left her family to come here —I say—. Without papers. She sends money home on the third Tuesday of every month. She has two small children. Her husband is an immigrant. At the moment, she lives in Ohio. She only spends three or four months a year at home, but her family manages quite well.

en: The minivan has become a kind of very small house: I am sitting in the passenger seat, which is the den. This is, I think, the best room in the house: there is plenty of space, and the chair is quite comfortable.
vi: Chiếc minivan đã trở thành một mái nhà nho nhỏ: Tôi đang ngồi ở ghế cạnh lái xe, chỗ này là phòng thư giãn. Tôi nghĩ đây là phòng tốt nhất trong nhà: rất rộng rãi, ghế khá thoải mái.
tr: Minivan bir bakıma küçük bir eve dönüştü: Ben dinlenme odası olan ön koltukta oturuyorum. Bu bence evin en iyi odası çünkü geniş ve koltuk oldukça rahat.
es: El monovolumen se ha convertido en una especie de casa diminuta. Yo estoy sentado en el asiento del copiloto, que es la sala de estar. Creo que es la mejor habitación de la casa. Es amplia y el asiento es muy cómodo.
vi_translation: The minivan has become a small home: I am sitting in the passenger seat, this is the relaxation room. I think this is the best room in the house: very spacious, the seat is quite comfortable.
tr_translation: The minivan has in a way turned into a small house: I am sitting in the front seat, which serves as a lounge. I think this is the best room in the house because it is spacious and the seat is quite comfortable.
es_translation: The minivan has turned into a kind of tiny house. I am sitting in the passenger seat, which is the living room. I think it is the best room in the house. It is spacious and the seat is very comfortable.

en: This first bench seat is the first bedroom. It’s the less desirable bedroom, because it is close to the kitchen and the living room, where people are awake and talking, and sometimes there is music on the radio.
vi: Hàng ghế băng đầu tiên là phòng ngủ số một. Không phải là phòng ngủ đáng ao ước lắm vì gần bếp và phòng khách, nơi mọi người thức, nói chuyện, thỉnh thoảng có nhạc qua sóng phát thanh.
tr: En öndeki çift kişilik koltuk, ilk yatak odası. Ez az istenen yatak odası çünkü insanların uyanık olduğu, konuştuğu ve bazen de radyoda müziğin olduğu mutfak ile oturma odasına yakın.
es: La primera fila de asientos es la primera habitación. Es la menos cómoda, porque está cerca de la cocina y de la sala, donde la gente está despierta charlando y a veces está puesta la radio.
vi_translation: The first row of benches is bedroom number one. It's not a very desirable bedroom because it's near the kitchen and living room, where people are awake, talking, and occasionally there's music on the radio.
tr_translation: The front double seat, the first bedroom. This is the desired bedroom because it is close to the kitchen and living room where people are awake, talking, and sometimes there is music on the radio.
es_translation: The first row of seats is the first room. It is the least comfortable because it is near the kitchen and the living room, where people are awake chatting and sometimes the radio is on.

en: I turn and look out at the highway as I hear a car coming. The white beast and her spotted friend have successfully ambled to the safety of the opposite shoulder, still impassive. Turning back, I realize the minivan is against the fence.
vi: Tôi quay lại nhìn ra đường cao tốc khi nghe thấy tiếng ô-tô chạy đến. Cô nàng trắng muốt và anh bạn đốm đã thủng thẳng ở vùng an toàn trên vai đường đối diện, vẫn rõ là nhởn nhơ vô tự lự. Quay lại, tôi thấy chiếc minivan đang húc vào hàng rào.
tr: Bir arabanın geldiğini duyunca dönüp anayola bakıyorum. Beyaz canavar ile benekli arkadaşı sahnarak karşı bankete geçip başanlı bir şekilde kendilerini emniyete almışlar, hâlâ umursamazlar. Arkama dönünce minivanın çite dayalı olduğunu fark ediyorum.
es: Oigo un coche, así que me giro y miro hacia la autopista. La bestia blanca y su amiga con manchas han llegado tranquilamente, sanas y salvas, a la otra cuneta, impasibles. Al volver a girarme veo que el monovolumen está contra la valla.
vi_translation: I turned back to look at the highway when I heard the sound of a car approaching. The pure white girl and her spotted friend were leisurely in the safe zone on the opposite shoulder, still clearly carefree and untroubled. Turning back, I saw the minivan crashing into the fence.
tr_translation: When I hear a car coming, I turn and look at the main road. The white monster and its spotted friend trot across to the opposite bank. They have successfully secured themselves, still indifferent. When I turn around, I notice that the minivan is leaning against the fence.
es_translation: I hear a car, so I turn around and look towards the highway. The white beast and its spotted friend have calmly arrived, safe and sound, at the other shoulder, unperturbed. When I turn around again, I see that the minivan is against the fence.

en: He pats my uninjured cheek with a greasy hand. “I did it to save myself, not you,” he says. “Believe me when I say that you did not once cross my mind.”
vi: Ben quệt bàn tay lem nhem dầu xe lên bên má lành của tôi. “Tôi làm thế để tự cứu mình chứ cứu gì ông,” nó nói. “Tin tôi đi, trong đầu tôi lúc đó không nghĩ tí tị tèo teo nào đến ông cả.
tr: Yağlı eliyle yaralı olmayan yanağıma vuruyor. “Kendimi kurtarmak için yaptım, seni değil,” diyor. “İnan ki sen aklıma bir kez bile gelmedin.
es: Me da una palmada en la mejilla con su mano grasienta. —Lo he hecho para salvarme a mí mismo, no a ti —contesta—. No he pensado en ti ni un segundo, créeme.
vi_translation: Ben wiped his greasy, oil-stained hand on my uninjured cheek. "I did it to save myself, not you," he said. "Believe me, at that moment, you didn't cross my mind at all."
tr_translation: He hits my uninjured cheek with his greasy hand. “I did it to save myself, not you,” he says. “Believe me, you never crossed my mind even once.”
es_translation: He gives me a slap on the cheek with his greasy hand. —I did it to save myself, not you —he replies—. I haven't thought about you for even a second, believe me.

en: Radar says, “Hey guys, do you remember that time I was double-seat-belted in the wayback and the door flew open and the beer fell out but I survived completely uninjured? How is that even possible?”
vi: Radar tiếp tục, “Các cậu có nhớ không hồi nớ tớ ở ghế sau ngủ mơ nói mớ cửa xe tự dưng mở chớ bia chảy ào ào qua tớ mà sao tớ khỏe re thế này tớ không nhớ sao mà kì diệu quớ!”
tr: Radar, “Hey çocuklar, arka tarafta çift emniyet kemeriyle bağlanmış olduğum, kapımn aniden açıldığı ve biranın döküldüğü ama benim kesinlikle yaralanmadan kurtulduğum zamanı hatırlıyor musunuz? Bu nasıl mümkün olabilir ki?” diyor.
es: —Eh, chicos, ¿recordáis aquella vez en que estaba tumbado en la parte de atrás, con los dos cinturones de seguridad puestos, y la puerta se abrió de golpe, todas las cervezas se rompieron, pero sobreviví totalmente ileso? —dice Radar—. ¿Cómo es posible?
vi_translation: Radar continued, "Do you guys remember that time when I was sleeping in the back seat and talking in my sleep, and the car door suddenly opened and beer poured all over me, but I felt completely fine? I don't remember how it happened, it's so miraculous!"
tr_translation: Radar, "Hey kids, do you remember the time I was strapped in the back with a double seatbelt, my door suddenly opened, and the beer spilled but I definitely escaped without injury?" "How could that be possible?" he says.
es_translation: —Hey, guys, do you remember that time when I was lying in the back, with both seat belts on, and the door suddenly opened, all the beers broke, but I survived completely unscathed? —says Radar—. How is that possible?

en: “Bullshit!” I shout, which it mostly is. “You were just playing with us, weren’t you? You just wanted to make sure that even after you left to go have your fun, you were still the axis we spun around.”
vi: “Nói vớ vẩn gì vậy!” tôi quát, gần như vậy. “Cậu chỉ chơi bọn tớ thôi đúng không? Cậu chỉ muốn đảm bảo rằng dù đã ra đi và có trò vui mới, nhưng cậu sẽ vẫn là cái trục để bọn tớ xoay mòng mòng xung quanh.
tr: “Saçmalama!” diye bağırıyorum çünkü genel olarak saçmalıyor. “Sadece bizimle oynuyordun, değil mi? Eğlenmek için çekip gittikten sonra bile, hâlâ etrafında döndüğümüz eksen olduğundan emin olmak istedin.
es: —¡Gilipolleces! —grito, y en buena medida lo son—. Solo estabas jugando con nosotros, ¿verdad? Solo querías asegurarte de que incluso después de marcharte a divertirte por ahí, todo seguía girando a tu alrededor.
vi_translation: “What nonsense are you talking about!” I shouted, almost like that. “You’re just playing us, right? You just want to make sure that even though you’ve left and have new fun, you will still be the axis around which we revolve.”
tr_translation: “Stop talking nonsense!” I shout because, generally, he is talking nonsense. “You were just playing with us, weren't you? Even after you left to have fun, you wanted to make sure you were still the axis around which we revolved.”
es_translation: —Nonsense! —I shout, and to a large extent, they are—. You were just playing with us, weren't you? You just wanted to make sure that even after you left to have fun elsewhere, everything still revolved around you.

en: She’s screaming back, louder than I thought possible. “You’re not even pissed at me, Q! You’re pissed at this idea of me you keep inside your brain from when we were little!”
vi: Margo hét trả, to hơn tôi nghĩ cô ấy có thể hét được. “Cậu thậm chí còn chẳng thèm nổi cáu với tớ, Q! Cậu chỉ cáu vì những tưởng tượng về tớ mà cậu giữ rịt trong đầu từ hồi bé thôi!”
tr: Karşılık olarak, mümkün olduğunu düşündüğümden daha yüksek sesle çığlık atıyor. “Bana kızgın bile değilsin, Q! Küçüklüğümüzden beri kafanın içinde tuttuğun bana dair fikre kızgınsın!
es: Y ella me grita también, más alto de lo que habría creído posible. —¡Ni siquiera te he decepcionado yo, Q! ¡Te ha decepcionado la idea de mí que te metiste en la cabeza desde que éramos niños!
vi_translation: Margo screamed back, louder than I thought she could scream. “You don't even bother to get mad at me, Q! You're just mad because of the fantasies about me that you've been holding onto since childhood!”
tr_translation: In response, she screams louder than I thought possible. "You're not even mad at me, Q! You're mad at the idea of me that you've kept in your head since we were kids!"
es_translation: And she yells at me too, louder than I would have thought possible. —I haven't even disappointed you, Q! It's the idea of me that you got into your head since we were kids that has disappointed you!

en: As dashed-together escape plans replete with clues go, I thought it was pretty impressive. But mostly I was surprised that she’d wanted me involved in her original plan, too. “Maybe you’ll fill me in,” I said, managing a smile. “I have, you know, been wondering. What was planned and what wasn’t? What meant what? Why the clues went to me, why you left, that kind of thing.”
vi: Khi những kế hoạch chạy trốn được phác vội với nhiều đầu mối ám chỉ sự ra đi, tôi đã nghĩ thế là rất ấn tượng. Nhưng tôi gần như ngạc nhiên rằng trong bản kế hoạch gốc cô ấy cũng muốn tôi tham gia vào. “Có lẽ cậu sẽ kể cho tớ biết chứ,” tôi nói, cố mỉm cười. “Cậu biết đấy, tớ đã thắc mắc nhiều. Điều gì có trong kế hoạch và điều gì không? Cái gì mang ý nghĩa gì? Tại sao các manh mối lại hướng vào tớ, tại sao cậu ra đi, đại khái thế.”
tr: İpuçlanyla dolu, birbirleriyle kesişen kaçış planlan bağlanımda gayet etkileyici olduğunu düşünmüştüm. Ama daha çok, beni asıl planına dâhil etmesine şaşkındım. “Bilmediğim şeylere bir açıklık getirsene,” dedim gülümsemeyi becererek. “Merak ediyordum da... Ne planlıydı, ne değildi? Ne, ne anlama geliyordu? Neden ipuçları bana geldi, neden gittin, böyle şeyler.
es: Como planes de huida precipitados llenos de pistas, me parecieron bastante impresionantes. Pero sobre todo me sorprendía que me hubiera incluido en sus planes desde el principio. —Ya me pondrás al corriente —le dije intentando sonreír—. Bueno, me pregunto muchas cosas. Qué habías planificado y qué no. Qué significaba cada cosa. Por qué las pistas iban dirigidas a mí. Por qué te marchaste…
vi_translation: When the hastily sketched escape plans with many clues hinting at the departure, I thought it was very impressive. But I was almost surprised that in the original plan she also wanted me to be involved. “Maybe you'll tell me,” I said, trying to smile. “You know, I've been wondering a lot. What is in the plan and what is not? What does everything mean? Why do the clues point to me, why are you leaving, that sort of thing.”
tr_translation: I had thought that the interwoven escape plans filled with clues were quite impressive. But more than that, I was surprised that he included me in his main plan. “Could you shed some light on the things I don't know?” I said, managing to smile. “I was curious... What was planned, what wasn't? What did everything mean? Why did the clues come to me, why did you leave, things like that.”
es_translation: As far as hastily made escape plans full of clues go, they seemed quite impressive to me. But above all, I was surprised that he had included me in his plans from the very beginning. —You'll bring me up to speed —I said, trying to smile—. Well, I wonder about many things. What you had planned and what you hadn't. What each thing meant. Why the clues were directed at me. Why you left…

en: “Um, okay. Okay. For that story, we have to start with a different story.” She gets up and I follow her footsteps as she nimbly avoids the rotting patches of floor. Returning to her office, she digs into the backpack and pulls out the black moleskin notebook. She sits down on the floor, her legs crossed, and pats a patch of wood next to her. I sit. She taps the closed book. “So this,” she says, “this goes back a long way. When I was in, like, fourth grade, I started writing a story in this notebook. It was kind of a detective story.”
vi: “Ừ, được. Được rồi. Với câu chuyện đó, chúng ta phải bắt đầu bằng một câu chuyện khác.” Margo đứng dậy, tôi theo sau trong khi Margo bước đi uyển chuyển, tránh những mảng sàn ọp ẹp. Quay trở lại góc làm việc, cô ấy tìm trong ba-lô và lấy ra cuốn sổ bìa da đen. Margo ngồi xuống sàn, bắt chéo chân và vỗ xuống sàn gỗ ngay cạnh cô ấy. Tôi ngồi xuống. Margo mở cuốn sổ ra. “Chuyện này,” cô ấy nói, “vậy là chuyện này bắt đầu từ lâu rồi. Hồi ấy khoảng lớp bốn, tớ bắt đầu viết vào đây. Một kiểu truyện trinh thám.”
